visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts treemap visualization that displays the global mortality rate for the year 2012, per 100,000 population. The data should be grouped by continents and further broken down by countries and causes of mortality. The chart should allow drilling down into more detailed data by clicking on the regions, countries, or causes. The chart should have a title 'Global Mortality Rate 2012, per 100 000 population', and the subtitle should provide a source link to the WHO data. The axes and labels should be styled with specific colors and font sizes for better readability.

subtitle.text: Click points to drill down. Source: WHO.

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a treemap visualization that represents the global mortality rate for the year 2012, per 100,000 population. The data is hierarchically structured, starting from continents down to specific causes of mortality. The chart allows users to drill down into more detailed data by clicking on the regions, countries, or causes. The title and subtitle are styled with specific font sizes and colors for better readability. The treemap uses a squarified layout algorithm to optimize the visual representation of the data. The chart also includes custom colors for the treemap tiles, enhancing the visual appeal and differentiation between different levels of data. The legend is disabled as the data is self-explanatory through the hierarchical structure and labels.
